translated: The Collection of Long Sayings .
The Questions of the Youth Mogharāja
“I asked Sakka twice,
(so said the venerable Mogharāja)
but the one with vision did not answer me;
but a third time the god-king
did answer me, so I have heard.
This world, the next world,
the world of Brahmā, and the world with its gods;
he does not know the view
of the famous Gotama.
Thus, one who sees so far,
I have come with a question;
how does one contemplate the world
so that the king of death does not see him?”
“Contemplate the world as empty,
Mogharāja, always mindful;
having given up the view of self,
thus one will be free from death;
thus contemplating the world,
the king of death does not see him.”
The Questions of the Youth Mogharāja is the fifteenth.
